page.title: 15Recording Studio, Knebworth.
page.content: There is a recording studio behind the Doctors' Surgery in Knebworth. In one of the rooms, behind a soundproof door, there are three keyboards. One keyboard was plugged into a computer with discdrive and each disc held sounds relating to different subjects ie animals, machines, or instruments. There is also a 24 track recording desk. They use a separate track to record a different instrument or voice for each record but may not use them all. The mixing studio has a ceiling which slopes downwards and meets foam on both sides. This is to prevent the sound from bouncing off the walls and being distorted. In the rest room next door we were told that a record costs about Â£5,500 to make. The sales profit is divided between the distributor, record shop, recording company and artist.
